instructions: From the Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings . Scroll down to 'Personal,' and then tap Lock screen and security . Tap Other security settings . Scroll to 'SIM card lock,' then tap Set up SIM card lock . If necessary, tap Lock SIM card to move the slider to ON and enable, and then enter your current SIM PIN and tap OK . Tap Change SIM card PIN . Enter your current SIM PIN. Note: The default SIM PIN is 1234 . Tap OK . Enter the new SIM PIN. Tap OK . Re-enter the new SIM PIN. Tap OK .

From the Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings . Scroll down to 'Personal,' and then tap Lock screen and security . Tap Other security settings . Scroll to 'SIM card lock,' then tap Set up SIM card lock . On Lock SIM card , move the slider to ON or OFF.

Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 1 1 Tap the Contacts or People app on your device. The process for all of this will vary depending on the manufacturer of your device and the contacts app you are using. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 2 2 Tap the or button. This is typically located in the upper-right corner. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 3 3 Tap or . You may have to tap Settings first. The wording may vary from device to device. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 4 4 Tap an ACCOUNT to view the contacts. When you select an account, you'll see all of the contacts that are saved to that account. Any contact that is connected to an account is automatically backed up and can be restored whenever you sign in again. For example, tapping "WhatsApp" will display all of your WhatsApp contacts. These contacts are stored on WhatsApp servers, so you don't need to worry about backing them up. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 5 5 Tap to view contacts stored on your phone. These are contacts that have been saved to your device's memory, and will need to be transferred to another account like Google or exported to a file. Contacts stored on your phone's memory will be erased if you perform a factory reset. Advertisement

Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 6 1 Open your Contacts app to the view. Your contacts app should just be displaying the contacts that are stored on your device's memory. Note that the terminology in this section will vary a lot depending on your phone manufacturer. The features discussed may not be available on all devices. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 7 2 Tap the or button. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 8 3 Tap or . Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 9 4 Tap or . The wording on this feature will vary a lot depending on your device. Look for a utility that allows you to transfer contacts from one account to another. If you don't have the ability to copy contacts to your Google account, you can still export your contacts as a file and them import them to Google. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 10 5 Tap in the list. If you are prompted to select the account you want to move contacts from, select your phone's storage. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 11 6 Tap your Google account in the list. Select your Google account in the list of accounts you can move your contacts to. This will ensure that they reappear when you sign back in with your Google account, and that they can be accessed from contacts.google.com . Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 12 7 Tap or . Your contacts will begin copying to your Google account. This may take a few moments if you are copying a lot of contacts. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 13 8 Visit contacts.google.com in your browser. You can verify that your contacts were successfully added here. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 14 9 Sign in with your Google account. Sign in with the same Google account you copied the contacts to. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 15 10 Find your newly-added contacts. If you see your contacts from your phone here, they have been safely backed up to Google. You may need to wait a little while for the contacts to sync. [1] Advertisement

Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 16 1 Tap the Contacts app on your device. If you can't copy your contacts directly to your Google account, you can export them to a file and then import that file to your Google account. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 17 2 Tap the or button. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 18 3 Tap or . You may have to tap the Settings option first. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 19 4 Tap the option. This will set the contacts app to only display contacts stored on your device, which are the contacts that need to be backed up. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 20 5 Tap the or button again. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 21 6 Tap or . Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 22 7 Tap the or option. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 23 8 Tap . Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 24 9 Tap your device's storage. This will set the contact file to save in your phone's storage. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 25 10 Tap the contacts you want to export. If you're given the option, tap the contacts you want to export. Since you restricted the view to the contacts just stored on your device, you can usually just tap "Select All." Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 26 11 Wait while your contacts export. You'll see a notification appear at the top of the screen when the contacts have finished exporting. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 27 12 Tap the or button in the Contacts app. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 28 13 Tap or . Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 29 14 Tap the option. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 30 15 Tap . Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 31 16 Tap your Google account. This will ensure that the imported contacts are added directly to your Google account. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 32 17 Tap your contact file. Tap the file that you just created when prompted. This will import the contacts from that file into your Google account, backing them up online. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 33 18 Visit contacts.google.com in your browser. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 34 19 Sign in with your Google account. Sign in with the same account you just imported the contacts to. Image titled Back Up Your Android Contacts to Your Google Account Step 35 20 Find your newly-imported contacts. Look for the contacts from your phone that you just imported. If you see them, they have been safely backed up to your Google account. [2] It may take a little while for the contacts to sync. Advertisement
